channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Trump Campaign’s Rhetoric About Women Sounds a Lot Like Andrew Tate’s

item.title: Ex-Twitter CISO Lea Kissner appointed as LinkedIn security chief
item.description: Kissner previously served as Twitter's chief information security officer, and held senior security and privacy positions at Apple, Google, and Lacewo...

item.title: Generative AI Transformed English Homework. Math Is Next
item.description: ByteDance’s Gauth app scans math homework and provides thorough, often correct, answers using AI. Millions have already downloaded it for free.

item.title: A comprehensive list of 2024 tech layoffs

item.title: Notorious Iranian Hackers Have Been Targeting the Space Industry With a New Backdoor

item.title: Tesla’s Supercharging network is still unavailable to non-Tesla EVs
item.description: It’s been more than a year since Tesla agreed to open its Supercharger network to electric vehicles from other automakers, like General Motors and For...

item.title: The Best All-in-One Computers, Tested and Reviewed (2024)
item.description: If you need a PC but don't want to ponder over all the specs and peripherals, get one of these all-in-one computers.

item.title: Tumblr to move its half a billion blogs to WordPress

item.title: The Plaud NotePin Is an AI Notetaker That Will Transcribe Your Meetings—and Your Entire Life

item.title: Google says it’s fixed Gemini’s people-generating feature
